intro: Rhodocolea multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered rhodocolea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its woody stems and adaptability to arid conditions make it a resilient species in its native habitat. Rhodocolea multiflora is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowering display.
